practice_goals: endgame basics: KP vs K, opposition drills
opening: 3 mainlines as White, 2 as Black (classical setups)

nodes.title: Understand the board, pieces, and notation
nodes.why: Knowing the baseline rules and recording system makes every future lesson understandable and legally sound.
outcomes: Explain how each piece moves, captures, and promotes.
Write algebraic notation for any legal move and basic checkmate.
Setup starting and simple endgame positions from FEN strings.

nodes.title: Drill core tactical motifs
nodes.why: Tactics decide most amateur games; repeated exposure teaches your brain to spot forks, pins, and mates instantly.
outcomes: Score at least 70% on mixed puzzle sets up to 1500 rating.
Recognize motifs like skewers, decoys, and deflections within five seconds.
Apply calculation discipline: candidate moves, forcing lines, blunder check.

nodes.title: Turn imbalances into plans
nodes.why: Evaluating pawn structure and piece activity helps you choose plans that exploit long-term advantages.
outcomes: Identify the best and worst placed pieces for both sides in a middlegame.
Outline a three-step plan aligned with pawn structure goals.
Explain why a plan failed using post-game annotations.

nodes.title: Secure king and pawn fundamentals
nodes.why: Endgame technique turns small advantages into wins and saves inferior positions by force.
outcomes: Win basic K+P vs K positions with correct opposition handling.
Convert outside passed pawn scenarios after simplification.
Demonstrate Lucena and Philidor setups for rook endgames.

nodes.title: Design a resilient opening repertoire
nodes.why: Prepared move orders steer games into familiar territory and save clock time during critical early decisions.
outcomes: List three trusted white systems and two black responses with key ideas.
Memorize critical tactical shots that punish early mistakes in your lines.
Annotate at least five personal reference games per chosen opening.

nodes.title: Create a disciplined game review loop
nodes.why: Structured analysis exposes recurring mistakes and transforms each game into feedback.
outcomes: Annotate every tournament game within 24 hours, highlighting critical decisions.
Tag mistakes as opening, tactic, strategy, or endgame for targeted training.
Summarize lessons learned and next actions in a training journal.

nodes.title: Build confident playing routines
nodes.why: Consistent practice online and over-the-board builds nerves, etiquette, and time management.
outcomes: Establish a warm-up checklist before every session.
Practice increment and classical time controls weekly.
Review sportsmanship guidelines for online and club play.

nodes.title: Explore chess engine building blocks
nodes.why: Understanding engine architecture unlocks new custom training tools and fosters deeper positional evaluation skills.
outcomes: Implement move validation and make/undo logic for a simple engine.
Experiment with evaluation tweaks and observe search strength changes.
Integrate UCI commands to analyze games with your custom bot.
